div.sent: The members of a state are called citizens of that state.
Citizens are permanent residents of a country.
They are loyal to the country.
We were born in Bangladesh.
We are citizens of Bangladesh.
As citizens, we have some rights.
At the same time we have some duties too.
The rights of a citizen mean his opportunities and privileges.
These rights are absolutely necessary for proper and smooth living.
In this lesson we will learn about two of the rights.
The rights essential for living in a society are known as social rights.
Let us read the main social rights in the following table.
The right to live is the basis of all other rights.
The right to property Every citizen has the right to acquire and enjoy property freely.
Every citizen has the right to move freel) inside his own country.
To speak in mother Language is our fundamental rights.
Similarly, to practise culture and observe festivals are also included in this right.
Let us read the political rights in the following table.
This right means the right to vote and the right to become a candidate.
Each citizen has the right to get a government job according to qualifications.
Each citizen has the right to express his grievances and problems and seek their solutions.
Let us copy the table below in our notebooks and write down three political rights.
The rights and duties are inter-dependent.
As citizens, we perform some duties towards the state.
These rights cannot be enjoyed if the duties are not performed rightly.
Let us read the duties of a citizen in the following table.
It is their duty to pay taxes regularly.
To vote It is an important duty.
Through it the citizens participate in the administration.
Their duty is to elect honest and competent people.
We are now children.
When we grow up, we will perform these duties and responsibilities.
